text: Why can I write some things out-of-order in python but not others?

When I try to run the code above, it gives an error:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:/Users/user/Documents/modules/ab.py", line 2, in 
    print a + b
NameError: name 'b' is not defined
Ok. a + b is called before b is defined.
That means Python runs the code in order, starts from top to down.

text: Above, self.final_days and self.maximum_days are not defined yet either, but it does not give any errors.
What is the logic behind it?
